title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 § 8128.69 - Town of Oyster Bay
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 § 8128.69 - Town of Oyster Bay

State Regulations
(a) Express Street, a town highway, between Basin Street and Executive Drive, a distance of
0.25± mile, is designated as an access highway for special dimension
vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the
hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. (b) Executive Drive, a county road, between Express Street and Sunnyside Boulevard, a distance of 0.55 mile, is designated as an access highway for special
dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used
between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. (c) Sunnyside Boulevard. Sunnyside Boulevard
between interchange 46 of I-495 (SH 59-2) and Terminal Drive, a distance of
0.20± mile, is designated as an access highway for special dimension
vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the
hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (d) Winding Road. Winding Road, a town
highway, between the truck terminal and Bethpage-Spagnoli Road, a distance of
0.2 mile. (e) Bethpage-Spagnoli

Road. Bethpage-Spagnoli Road, a town highway, between Winding Road and the

Nassau-Suffolk county line, a distance of 0.2 mile. (f) Route 106. Route 106 between Route
106-107 and West John Street; provided, however, that this route shall only be
used between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (g) West John Street, a town highway, between

Route 106 (SH 546) and Charlotte Street/Avenue, a distance of 1.1 miles, is
designated as a access highway for special dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7
a.m. (h) Charlotte Street/Avenue, a
town highway, between West John Street and the Williams Machinery truck
terminal, a distance of 0.3 mile, is designated as an access highway for
special dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be
used between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. (i) Terminal Drive. Terminal Drive between

Sunnyside Boulevard and Ames Court, a distance of 0.3± mile is
designated as an access highway for special dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and
7:00 a.m. (j) Ames Court. Ames

Court between Terminal Drive and South Terminal Drive, a distance of
0.10± mile is designated as an access highway for special dimension
vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the
hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (k) South Terminal Drive. South Terminal

Drive between Ames Court and Commercial Street, a distance of 0.10± mile
is designated as an access highway for special dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and
7:00 a.m. (l) Commercial Street. Commercial Street between South Terminal Drive and Skyline Drive, a distance of
0.10± mile is designated as an access highway for special dimension
vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the
hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (m) Skyline Drive. Skyline Drive between

Commercial Street and Express Street, a distance of 0.10± mile is
designated as an access highway for special dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and
7:00 a.m. (n) Express Street. Express Street between Skyline Drive and the Yellow Freight Service, Inc. terminal, a distance of 100 feet is designated as an access highway for special
dimension vehicles; provided, however, that this route shall only be used
between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. (o) Route 107. Route 107 between interchange
41 of I-495 and Engineers Drive. (p) Engineers Drive. Engineers Drive between

Route 107 and the ABF Freight Systems, Inc. truck terminal, a distance of
0.2± mile. (q) Route 107. Route 107 between interchange 41 of I-495 and Route 25. (r) Route 25. Route 25 between Route 107 and

Route 135. (s) Route 135. Route 135
between Route 25 and interchange 44 of I-495. (t) Gordon Drive. Gordon Drive between Route
25 and the Roadway Services Incorporated property, a distance of 0.5±
mile. (u) Alpha Plaza Drive. Alpha

Plaza Drive between West John Street and the Roadway Express
facility. (v) Route 24. Route 24
between Route 135 and Hempstead-Oyster Bay town line. (x) Merrick Road between Hempstead/Oyster Bay
town line and Route 107. (y) Route
107 between Merrick Road and Route 27. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
§
8128.69

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
